relationships.name: Jean-Paul Sartre
relationships.description: Lifelong partner and fellow existentialist. Shared key concepts like freedom and bad faith, though Beauvoir focused more on the ethical and social implications.

relationships.name: Maurice Merleau-Ponty
relationships.description: Philosophical peer. His phenomenology of the body influenced her understanding of how the body is situated in the world.

relationships.name: Albert Camus
relationships.description: Fellow writer and philosopher. Initially close, but they diverged on political grounds regarding communism and the Soviet Union.

relationships.name: Friedrich Nietzsche
relationships.description: Influenced her views on the death of God and the necessity of creating one's own values.

relationships.name: Immanuel Kant
relationships.description: She engages with Kantian ethics, accepting the idea of treating humanity as an end, but criticizing the abstract nature of his moral law.
